results.title: Renaissance of a river : the story of the Susquehanna / told by the Interstate Advisory Committee
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: The Susquehanna River is undergoing a massive water management programme - a wastewater treatment plant is being built to combat pollution, a reservoir is under construction to maintain a steady flow, drought and floods notwithstanding, and the upper reaches are being developed as a tourist resort on a large scale

results.title: Rapid tunnelling in soft ground
results.brief_description: “Summary: robbins’ excavator shield tunnelling system is a soft ground tunnelling machine. it consists of a dydraulically propelled shield with an excavator mounted in the top of the main section. there is no rotating head - the shape of the shield can be varies to suit the ultimate use of the tunnel. this film shows the machine in action during the construction of the detroit sewer tunnel in 1971”
results.description: “Summary: robbins’ excavator shield tunnelling system is a soft ground tunnelling machine. it consists of a dydraulically propelled shield with an excavator mounted in the top of the main section. there is no rotating head - the shape of the shield can be varies to suit the ultimate use of the tunnel. this film shows the machine in action during the construction of the detroit sewer tunnel in 1971”

results.title: Quiet please
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: An explanation of what noise is, where it most commonly occurs, how it affects the human body, and what can be done to reduce or eliminate it by industry and research laboratories

results.title: Pay for performance
results.brief_description: Summary: Saul Gellerman and Emanuel Kay discuss how to avoid negative effects of poorly understood pay policies, how to ensure maximum advantage from salaries and wages and goal setting as a replacement for traditional performance appraisal programs

results.title: Motivation in perspective
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Saul Gellerman summarises theories of several experts concerning management and notes that the theme of each of these theories is that employees are not being used at their full capacity. Shows how the theories of each expert reinforce the theories of the others.
